# Buxton (1920). buxton
Outliers are in buxy observations 61-65 for buxy values.
mtot = 87, m_outliers = 5, n=5.
One sample from original dataset deleted because of missing values.  Not using two columns from the original dataset because of missing values.
```{r echo=FALSE}
source("olive/mrobdata.txt")
buxton <- data.frame(buxy, buxx)

buxton <- rbind(buxton[-c(61:65), ], buxton[61:65,])
write.table(buxton, 
            file="olive/m82n5_buxtoni3.csv", 
            row.names = FALSE, 
            col.names = FALSE,
            sep=",")
```

# Gladstone (1906).  glado  
Nine points from original dataset omitted because of missing values.  6 infants are good leverage points - rest of data is for adults.  Observation 115 has a mis-entered "len" value of 109.
mtot = 267, m_outliers = 1, n=12.
```{r echo=FALSE}
source("olive/mrobdata.txt")
glado <- data.frame(gladoy, gladox)

#infants <- which(glado$age < 1) # these are good leverage points
#glado <- rbind(glado[-c(infants,115), ], glado[c(infants,115),])
glado <- rbind(glado[-c(115), ], glado[c(115),])
write.table(glado, 
            file="olive/m266n12_gladoi1.csv", 
            row.names = FALSE, 
            col.names = FALSE,
            sep=",")
```
